website_summaries.verdict: These straps are 12 feet long and a very good value for the price. The weight limit is only 200 pounds.
pros: Price is excellent considering that 6 straps are included
Come with a carrying pouch for storage when straps aren't in use
cons: These straps aren't as heavy-duty as some others
They're okay for moderate cargo needs but not extreme weights

customer_reviews.title: STRAPS!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome straps. They strap just like a strap should strap. If you need a strap to strap things than need to be strapped these straps will definately strap it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Looked good.....but
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I opened the package. Buckles are good, straps could have been heavier material but not super thin like others that I have seen. I used them strap a new door to the top of my SUV. I pulled the strap to tighten and the buckle held great. When I checked the other side to run another strap, the strap had ripped from the strain on the door edge. This is a new, high end door, well finished and certainly an easier edge than a 2x4. I ran another strap and the same thing happened. Maybe I got a bad batch but I am disappointed. I used rope to secure the door.
customer_reviews.author: unclemike

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for a set of reasonably heavy-duty lashing straps.
customer_reviews.text: This set of 6 straps should take care of most of your car rooftop lashing needs. We use these straps for lashing down kayaks and they work really well. The cam buckle is smooth and grabs and holds the strap well. The straps themselves are fairly heavy, compared to some thinner straps I purchased not long ago at Harbor Freight. I don't think that you can do any better in getting a nice set of straps for such an inexpensive price.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted one kayak trip
customer_reviews.text: Edges frayed while feeding through cam and was not able to feed the strap back through the cam when it was time to unload my kayak. I had to cut the straps to get my kayak off the car, then use the second pair to take it home, where I had to cut those as well. These are too expensive for one time use.
customer_reviews.author: Lance rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fail! Buckles doesn’t keep tension
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to secure a bike cover to my bike while it was on my bike carrier. I used 4 straps to be safe. I didn’t want the cover to blow off. I stopped at a rest stop to check the straps and good thing I did, all four straps had loosened. The buckles did not keep the straps taught. I reverted back to my bungee cords. I figured these straps would work better, but they did not. Very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnimeister

customer_reviews.title: A one use tie down strap.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used 3 of the tie down straps. Each of the staps got snagged on the teeth inside of the buckle when I tried to open the buckles and loosen the straps. I had no choice but to cut them off and discard them after one use. These straps are not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: skierjoe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kayaks
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd set of these straps I have purchased! I have a smallish SUV (Chevy Trax) that I haul two kayaks all over Illinois with. The length of these straps is perfect to go around the kayak and under the racks, and also for front and rear tie downs. I also use one on the back of the kayak, keeping my tackle boxes safe in case I flip over! I love that they come with a carrying bag, I keep the spares in the trunk for emergency situations.
customer_reviews.author: T. Redding

customer_reviews.title: Cam slippage?
customer_reviews.text: These straps are a good value, but they have limitations. The black dye is not colorfast. The first time I used the straps in the rain, some of the color bled onto my orange raft, leaving black marks. My biggest concern is with the cam mechanism. On several occasions, the straps loosened 6-8 inches when I was driving at highway speed with the raft on the roof rack. That was when I was using two straps to lash the raft down. Now I use four straps and, so far, I haven't had problems.
customer_reviews.author: STG

customer_reviews.title: Works great for securing recumbent trike on roof.
customer_reviews.text: I use these straps (in conjunction with triangular foam blocks from another kit) to lock down my recumbent trike on the roof of my van. I just loop them around the factory roof rack rails and up through the trike. I much prefer these kinds of straps over the ratcheting kind with hooks at the end, as fishing straps with hook ends through bike wheels with spokes can be quite irritating. These are quick to sift through, lock down, and tie off the extra length off to the side. They stay locked in place and from what I've seen don't loosen when traveling. No complaints. Easy to use and quick to lock in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Safer than bungees. I hate being asked to write a story about everything I buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I will hold items in the top of my Westfalia camper bin with these straps. Not that heavy duty, but yay safer than bungees. The storage bag was a nice touch. I've already submitted this. Leave me alone.
customer_reviews.author: Super Seven

customer_reviews.title: good for the price, not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: These are not heavy duty. They are kind of narrow and work great for strapping some things into the truck, but I use them for very heavy important things. We tied down a couch in my truck bed, but it didn't seem like they would hold if I went over a big bump or went on the freeway. These are not the big bulky kind with crank downs, but that's why they are cheap. You are paying a little money for a little security. If you want more, pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii T

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution.
customer_reviews.text: I got really tired trying to keep my boat cover tight enough to prevent pooling. I was using straps with the plastic clips that pull apart when you try to tighten them. When I saw these, for the price, I had to buy them. They are the perfect solution. They tighten easily and don't slip. Releasing them is very easy though. They were longer than I needed, but cut easily with scissors. I heated (melted) the cut ends with a candle flame, and they will never unravel. My boat cover doesn't sag any more. I love these things!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps Too Strong-Maybe 6 Stars?
customer_reviews.text: Really, there's nothing wrong with these straps. I decided on 4, instead of 5 stars, solely because the springs on the clasps are so strong that I had a difficult time threading the loose end of the strap through the clasp. I can imagine a younger and stronger person giving these 6 starts for the strong clasps. In all, they seem adequate for the intended purpose and a good buy. Buy with confidence... but eat your Wheaties!
customer_reviews.author: Nightrunner

customer_reviews.title: I wish Cartman came with hooks
customer_reviews.text: I use Cartman all the time... but sometimes I'd like hooks instead of doing a loop around the load. So I bought some SmartStraps with hooks. Wow, the buckles were HUGE, and a bit harder to thread. The smaller Cartman buckle is the orange strap in my pics. Watch out for the load rating on cambuckle straps, some are 200lb and some are 300lb.
customer_reviews.author: S. EckertTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed; you get what you pay for,,, Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to tie down my surfboard to my roof rack. The trouble I had with these is the nylon strap is to thin and allows the cleat on the clamp to become stuck leaving it impossible to release the strap when time to remove my board. I had to cut the straps off after letting my friends have a go at it. I would avoid getting these and spend a few dollars more for better quality and thicker nylon straps on the tie down.
customer_reviews.author: Paloma Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet Strap for Dummies Love
customer_reviews.text: I have used this type of strap for a couple years. I call them the ratchet strap for dummies because it doesn't take me a lot of time and fuss to get them where I want them, no ratcheting, no tangling, no muss no fuss. Easy to use, anchor in place without any problem and stays where I put it. They don't stretch, I have never had a pair fray on anything yet. Easy to thread, easy to release and tighten. Once they are where you want them they don't move.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: flawed design & manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: The grabber/pinch teeth are so sharp that you must release the tension before you can pull the band off the teeth. See the picture of what happens when, with just a few pounds of load on the strap, I tried to pull the strap back through - with the grabber released, of course. The teeth on the grabber embed into the weave and, due ot the design, will not let go. This is an unfortunate design/manufacturing flaw as otherwise they seemed decent. Stitching looked good and the metal parts were fairly well formed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Kept my broken Thule roof box together on a 500 Mile trip.
customer_reviews.text: Our 15yr old Thule roof box was closing but not latching properly, (mechanism broke due to a design flaw). While we were on vacation. Thanks to the power of Amazon I had this set of straps sent to the vacation house before our return trip. They were very strong and worked perfectly for this situation. Crisis averted. I have since replaced the roof box with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use these if you need it lashed very tight.
customer_reviews.text: If you tighten these too tight you can’t have enough slack to back the strap out. The teeth bite into the strap and tear it to pieces. I couldn’t get my kayak off the racks and had to cut the strap with a knife. Thankfully I had more straps than I needed for the return trip home or I would have had a problem. I do not recommend these at all. The issue is the teeth on the clamp and the poor quality strap material being too weak to avoid damage from these teeth.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, low quality construction
customer_reviews.text: These straps are cheap and not worth the money. I used them one time, and the clasp got stuck and would not disengage, on all of the straps not just one. I had to use pliers and vice grips to get the clasp to disengage, but the straps were ruined because the low quality nylon webbing of the strap was snagged an torn where the clasp bit into the material. This are basically one time use disposable straps. I do not recommend them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, satisfied, satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a total of four times now and could not be more satisfied with the quality of this product. The only thing I found while using these was the black color from the fabric of the straps turned my fingers black the first two times of using them. Not a big deal for me overall. The canvas carrying bag for all six straps is uber convenient and of very nice quality also. It didn't really occur to me how nice it was until I stowed away the straps!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Heintzman

customer_reviews.title: Okay for me, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Love the length. Easy to use. They didn't seem to hold as well as others I have purchased in the past. I don't know if the material used is a little too 'slippery', for lack of a better word. Luckily I had 6 straps on my load. One had come off with the wind (Load on top of my SUV). Pulled over and put back in place.
customer_reviews.author: JoAQUIN tRUJILLO

customer_reviews.title: Cheap nylon
customer_reviews.text: Nylon is lose enough of a weave that fibers are pulled by the cleat. Almost impossible to release. I might upload pics later. I was just using them to secure a tent and easy up from shifting in a cartop carrier. Certainly nowhere near the 600# they are rated at. Save you money and look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: QuietFire

customer_reviews.title: Good Straps, But Leave Their Mark
customer_reviews.text: Quality lashing straps that also come with a nice storage bag for a great price. I used these to secure a canoe to my roof rack. The only downside is that these straps leave black residue all over your hands after handling them. I'll have to try washing them to see if I can't get them to stop "shedding."
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 of them worked
customer_reviews.text: The first 3 we tried did not work, and we assumed theyall were the same and we were going to return them. But then we realized that 2 worked good and 1 more sort of worked. As we only needed 3 straps, we decided to keep them. By not work; I mean they would not tighten when pulled on. These types of straps are supposed to allow you to tighten them once they are done up around something. Only 2 of them did this well,and one other one kind of did it if you struggle with it. They are strong. The black dye does come off on your hands, so I wouldnt use them on bare furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Doris O. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Got ruined on the first use
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me. I used it to move my new kayak from the store to my house. The straps were useful, the kayak didn't fall, which is why i give the product 2 stars. That was the first and last time I was able to use the straps, they continusly slipped and would not lock properly, I ended up grateful that I was able to carry my kayak that one time, but decided not to risk it again, because my kayak kept moving as the straps slipped open every few miles. I don't recommend this product to move kayaks around, they will surely give you a case of anxiety on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Ella K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this. Frays with first use.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say, not pleased. The strap itself is fine...that is until it is used for strapping something down/in. The metal clips used to secure the strap chew the straps down to nothing. I used the strap once and it’s already frayed so much that I will never use it again for valuable cargo. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Does not allow “Quick” release!
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend! The latch with “Quick” release should not get stuck to the point you almost have to cut the line to get lose. Every use! It’s horrible. Even after loosening tension it still does. Or wanna release. Hopefully I can send back and rather spend full extra dollars for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: crazy-cruz20

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The first strap I removed from the package and wrapped on through my kayak rack and around kayak, I tighten it down. I then released tension, to my surprise it would not release. The teeth dug into the strap and pinched the strap so bad it took me five minutes to get it undone. Now the strap is useless. I thought about trying another one since my order came with six straps. I decided against it and will be returning product.
customer_reviews.author: P.R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: With lashing straps I've used in the past, I can tighten when needed and reuse multiple times. These straps don't allow that as there are teeth on the buckle component, shredding the nylon. Ordered three boxes, excited to have a neon color so it would stand out/easy to locate items I store for work. First two shredded when trying to reuse, third and fourth one I cut the buckle off and used the strap as a large tie.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Huck

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!  Ink bleeds onto what you lash together
customer_reviews.text: These straps were not the highest quality compared to other brands rated at this strength. The biggest problem: I used them to lash down the seats in my boat while I travel on the road. The first time I used them, the ink bled out of them and onto the seats, staining the seats with a black stripe where were. The stains do not seem to want to come out, so now my expensive boat has tan seats with a black stripe where the straps were. DO NOT BUY THESE IF YOU DON'T WANT YOU GEAR DISCOLORED BY THE STRAPS. I will be looking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nardi

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but certainly not great
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to operate! The problem is that the clearance is so ridiculously small that it could be difficult to thread the belt into the jaws. At first I tried to cut the straps and then use heat to melt the end; that didn’t work because there’s literally no clearance for anything except a perfectly flat belt. So I used the belts as I got them, and the ends begin to fray after only a few days... Meaning it was really hard to thread them. Once you get them set up they seem very stable, but I think you could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Cavediver

customer_reviews.title: Grip Too Well
customer_reviews.text: These straps worked a little too good. I used them one time to strap my kayaks to the rack. It took me forever to get them to release when I was ready to take my kayaks down. They grip the material so hard that it pulls the threads in the material, which then grip so that you can't simply release using the button. Good concept, but bad design. Great if you're looking to "permanently" secure something, but not for short term traveling and reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk, not as described
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT lashing straps, just pretty ribbons with a super soft imitation metal, that holds the so-called straps like silver foil. Avoid, don't waste your money. I just threw them out, since a First Class stamp would have cost more to send them back then they cost to make. NOT as described.
customer_reviews.author: Techie US reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to use and secure.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for: "CARTMAN 1" x 12' Lashing Straps up to 600lbs, 2-10pk in Carry Bag (10pk)" I have purchased these straps previously, and they worked extremely well. So when I needed more I ordered the same kind. They are very easy to use and to quickly install. They hold things together very securely. There are several colors available. The orange ones stand out strikingly and seem to do pretty well in sunlight too. Overall, this is a great product with many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Help

customer_reviews.title: clasp is stiffl and difficult to use when it's under pressure
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these for anything important....spend a few extra bucks and get a name brand like Thule or NRS. The clasp on these is too small and difficult to use. Also the ribbon started shredding almost immediately. I ended up just having to cut them off because I could not put enough pressure....even with pliers...on the buckle to get it to release. They would probably be fine for very light duty but you might as well put your money towards ones that you can use for everything. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie & Kates Mom

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, easy to use, Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a stand up paddleboard. It's a GRECO, only 28 lbs, but over 12' long and difficult to transport. We had to put towels between the straps and the board, so the board would not get damaged. Not the fault of the belts. My board is made out of the stuff they make "boogie boards" with. My board stayed securely fastened going 60 miles an hour on the highway. Haven't been able to use my board for 2 years. Getting rid of the inflatable
customer_reviews.author: Ricki Judith

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not designed for many uses.
customer_reviews.text: When you spend only $12 for four straps, you can't expect professional quality. I had in mind a single use, and they worked for that. However, the reviewers who said they had difficulty releasing the straps were correct. The only way I could do it was to release the clasp and pull as though I was tightening them again. That released them. The straps are narrow, and are of too course a weave for the clasp (my interpretation of the problem). But, they are cheap, so you can't expect great quality.
customer_reviews.author: David May

customer_reviews.title: Total rubbish!
customer_reviews.text: These (green) straps are so thin (rated for 600lbs, really...) they get twisted in the cam lock and impossible to unlock. If you manage to unlock the teeth of the cam lock, you will end up with damaged strap. I attempted to tie down my light windsurfing boards and sails with a few of these and they got jammed immediately. Total rubbish!
customer_reviews.author: IVash

customer_reviews.title: One-Time Use
customer_reviews.text: I installed 2 of these straps in the back of my car to hold down a pretty light box. When I went to remove the straps, I noticed the material was frayed, and really chewed up. The grip teeth on the clips are way too sharp for the soft material of these straps. You'd think the extra grip would be good, but the sharp teeth literally shred the strap material and make it almost impossible to remove them, once they're snug & holding something down. Avoid these straps, unless you enjoy returning Amazon items. They are essentially disposable after one or two uses.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C.

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: These straps are absolute junk. The cam seats into the fibers of the strap so deeply after tying down the load that you can’t release the buckle when you need to remove it. Literally only lasted me one use because they all had to be cut off. Save yourself the headache and go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for this purpose
customer_reviews.text: Used these along with carabiners to secure 3 hammocks to palm trees in my backyard. These worked great for this purpose. They hug the tree snuggly and do not give or sag. These are much better than rope and much less expensive than special purpose hamock straps/solutions. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Varnell

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have a set of these
customer_reviews.text: I used this to help secure a soft-sided cargo bag on the roof of my car when I had to relocate 1500 miles through some pretty rough weather and constant downpours. They made everything secure. Do have to say that I only gave this three stars on the 'easy to use' question because they didn't come with instructions at all. It was a trick to figure out how to use them since I had never used a ratcheting strap before. They really should have a small instruction sheet. But these are some really handy things to have around for all sorts of applications, and the price a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie Bryan

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: I used these once and maybe I got them too tight? But I had to cut the straps with scissors to get them off,I've used other straps and tighten-them just like these,but when I tried to push the small lever down to release straps they just wouldn't release.Si when I use them now I don't tighten them to the fullest.By the way when I did not tighten them and released them the edges frayed.I basically purchased these for a friend.The4re are several left so we will use them till they break and get some other product.
customer_reviews.author: Maz

customer_reviews.title: Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: Love them for the price but mine were one-use and I had to cut them off. Bought them to travel cross country with two kayaks on my rack. Super strong hold and they worked perfectly. Then I wanted to take them off. The gnarled edge of the cam is so aggressive that it chewed into the fibers of the webbing. I was unable to remove them at all. So I simply cut them off.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy4130

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Release
customer_reviews.text: The straps work well enough, but the teeth on the clamp are such that they dig into the strap itself, and when you thumb the release to open it up, the teeth stay stuck in the fabric of the strap. Its as if the teeth are too long and/or sharp and when the release is pushed and the teeth pull back, it is as if they bring some of the strap material up at the same time and it just wont release. It is necessary to both pull tighter and push the release at the same time. Sometimes, it is impossible to pull tighter. I have considered filing one down to see if it helps.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use in the shop securing stuff to pallets where they are regularly being moved and adjusted. Love the bright green color and they slip on quick and easy, exactly what I was looking for. Very reasonably priced, I bought 3 or 4 packs. They came with a convenient drawstring bag for storage, I dumped all my surplus straps in one bag and hung it up on our pallet rack that uses these the most. Very satisfied with the straps, they bite nice and release easy, recommend for anyone needing some good lashing straps.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: As other reviews stated, the dye on the straps ...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews stated, the dye on the straps will come off and bleed into other things when wet so keep that in mind when using these straps outdoors. You can do some preventative action to this problem by intentionally fading the straps, I did so by soaking in hot water and bleach. They look sun faded now but I haven't had issues yet with the dye bleeding. I use the straps to strap stuff to my motorcycle panniers.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: I mildly wish they were ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to tighten and loosen, used with a roof bag when we went camping. I suggest either some skirting or waterproofing spray to keep water from coming inside when it rains, because having something breaking the rubber seal on the door Will let water in. 16 hours round trip at speeds no more than 70. More adjustable than the straps that came with the bag and certainly sturdier. Plus I got a four pack in case something went wrong but I will use these for years of camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: M3lm0

customer_reviews.title: Strap me down baby!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping my spare tire on my roof rack over the past 6 months through rain, sun, and a bit of ice n' snow. The color has faded, my tire had to be re-inflated a few times (that used tires place ripped me off, such slimy folks), but it still holds up wonderfully. The buckle design retains the tension like a boss and aside from the faded colors, it really doesn't look/feel like it has lost any structural integrity. And honestly, with the sheer amount of straps you get for the money, this is quite the bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: YakooziJacuzzi

customer_reviews.title: They do the trick
customer_reviews.text: I've had and used these straps for some months now. They do the trick. They are strong and the metal buckle, locking tensioner part does the job. It sticks well to the strap webbing material, and doesn't seem to slip with use. I thought I would cut these straps shorter once I got them, but they came in handy to tie around other stuff while holding something in place, so I will keep them long. The color is bright orange, as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: SP Camera DP

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Cam Straps
customer_reviews.text: These are literally useless. The teeth on the cam are way to sharp, they bite deep into the super thin webbing making it impossible to release under tension. I ended up having to cut off every one I used. I was only using them to secure no more that two ladders at a time on my roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Lace

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheap set of straps that will be used to lash down some kayaks for a short trip on a trailer once a year. I was not looking for something that was going to last me for years through heavy use or I would have bought better quality straps at a higher price. They are what they are and good straps for the money. You can't buy cheap and expect the best. The world doesn't work that way, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: David Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: They did the job that I needed. Which was to hoist and secure kayaks to the garage ceiling. However, one of the threads of the webbing caught in the feed thru portion of the clip and shredded itself. A real bummer. I've been using this style strap for ever and never had that happen before. Good enough for holding something to the ceiling but I wouldnt trust it with anything of value on trailer going down the highway.
customer_reviews.author: John LaBarge

customer_reviews.title: hard to release the straps
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of tie down and the price of this set was incredible. The carry sack is great for storing and keeping them handy in my vehicle. A surprising downside of these Cartman straps was that when cinched really tight, the latch toggles close so far that it can be extremely hard to release them. I think this is especially true with slightly squishy loads such as a couple of mattresses I carried the other day. I had to resort to using pliers to release them and was worried that I might break or bend the buckles.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: Complete and total junk!
customer_reviews.text: Junk, junk, junk! I should have known better, you get what you pay for. These straps are impossible to get off. They get stuck with the strap in the teeth and have to be cut off. So if you WANT SINGLE USE ONLY straps then definitely get these. But they have know utility for me. Stick to name brands. At my local kayak store I can get 2 straps for 12. That's probsbly more reasonable. Avoid these at all cost.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Buckle teeth snag lightweight straps
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in how thin the straps are compared to other buckle straps I've used. The worse part is that the buckle teeth are sharply pointed and snag the flimsy straps, making them impossible to loosen without fiddling with the buckle-the buckles have to be completely opened and the straps carefully pulled through. Once the straps are snagged they are even more difficult to move through the buckles.
customer_reviews.author: Scot Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Would not release had to cut it off!
customer_reviews.text: I needed straps to secure my bike rack and it worked great until I need to release it to fold the rack down...the strap would not release. I was forced to cut it off. Then I tried the second strap putting it on a little different, so that I had clear access to the handle (I assumed I had done something wrong the first time). Again it would not release! Had to cut the second one off as well. Pretty a much a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: These are crap. Buy the good kind.
customer_reviews.text: The metal teeth are very rough and the webbing is very soft so when you tighten them down, the teeth dig into the threads of the webbing and get stuck. Or the webbing twists around as you pull and then you're truly screwed. Good luck getting that past those gnarly teeth. I've used these twice and have had to throw out three straps because they unraveled or got so stuck I had to cut them free. While soaking wet. In the blowing rain. The bag is the best part. I'm keeping that.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than bungee cords!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to attach a motorcycle touring bag to the luggage rack on my Harley Davidson Ultra Limited. Super simple to use, I cut them to the length that I wanted, then burned the ends to prevent fraying. Once you tighten them down they don't loosen at all. I drove over 3500 miles with two of these and had zero issues with them loosening or moving around. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cropper

customer_reviews.title: Buckle Teeth too sharp
customer_reviews.text: I used the straps to tie down a shovel and a jack to my load platform on top of my truck. Good: straps were easy to attach and held both pieces firmly in place for over 1500 miles on the road. Bad: I could not loosen the straps to take the shovel or jack off the platform when I needed to use them. The teeth in the buckle embedded in the nylon strap. I was unable to loosen the straps, even with clear space between the strap and buckle. Ended up taking a knife to all of them and just cutting them off. Straight to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob443

customer_reviews.title: Latches become stuck and damage the straps
customer_reviews.text: I've bought straps from this brand before in the bright green six pack and they were excellent. These straps were not of the same quality. The teeth on the latches are so sharp that they become embedded in the strap material and cannot be undone with out tightening them even more while simultaneously trying to release the latch. Once released, the strap becomes frayed and clearly damaged. Not sure what has changed but i would not recommend these straps.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoying and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I hate these. I bought a different brand first which I loved and bought these thinking they were the same, which they are far from. Not only are they ridiculously hard to loosen, they started stretching while in transport and I had to pull over to check them twice on a 20 minute drive. Where they were being held down is all ripped up by the teeth too. Very annoying, cheap plasticity, not very sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Morg

customer_reviews.title: Teeth bite to much
customer_reviews.text: The teeth on the cam buckle come to a point which really, really bites into the webbing, it caused me some fighting with it to get it to release. I’ve fixed the problem by using my dremel tool to grind the points down so it won’t bite into the webbing. There is a fine line of just right and to much which then it won’t bite down. For the price and little work, the value is there
customer_reviews.author: Troy Haskett

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, better choices.
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 of the 4 straps for securing a few items in my truck bed. The major flaw with these straps is when you release the buckle, the teeth have bitten in to the fabric. You have to pull the strap even tighter to dislodge from the teeth, but that pulls out strands of thread from the strap, sometimes leaving chewed up visible gaps. These might be OK if you consider these a one and done disposable product. Otherwise, there are much better choices.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: holding my trampoline perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought to hold down a trampoline. They are working great. The only issue I have run into is getting them back apart. The friction point is almost too spikey and the spikes want to pull at the webbing and catch instead of release. I only have to move the trampoline once a season so I’m not concerned. Actually believe it is better they struggle to come apart so it stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These straps are garbage. I secured my 2 kayaks to my luggage rack. It was hard to tighten the straps. They kept loosening as I drove. I had to stop several times to re-secure the straps. Then, trying to press the release lever on the clamp was an ordeal; the teeth of the clamp had shredded the strap material and become entangled. It was a struggle to use these. I eventually stopped on the side of the road and traded out these straps for some ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.author: haloreach 1514

customer_reviews.title: Straps don't release easily under pressure
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these straps to help with a recent move. The straps were sturdy and held effectively -- a little too effectively. When we tightened the straps too tight, the teeth on the latch would dig in to the strap and we had a hard time getting them to release. The lesson I learned is don't tighten them too tight -- you will need to be able to pull forward to release the latch and if there is any significant pressure on the straps or they are otherwise to tight, this will be difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I use them to secure large Kayaks, have been very happy with this product. They grip well, are easy to operate, I completely skip the frustration of Ratchet straps. The bright ones are easy to see in dusk and dark situations. Be sure you get the right length for what you need. And I have had occasion to use two of them together to make a longer one and it worked out fine, I think it's probably not recommended, but it's doable in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Black dye from straps stained my bikes under the rain
customer_reviews.text: Lashing straps are worse than garbage. They work fine, but when I strapped my 2 expensive bikes with them, it rained, and the dye from straps permanently stained both bikes. Horrible, horrible garbage. Do not buy unless you’re OK with black stains on whatever you strap with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for only one use and then ruined by faulty design.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid these straps. The overly long and sharp teeth on the binding clip destroys the strap when removing. They are good for a one time use and then you will throw them away. I wish that I would have read the reviews before buying these as other people have pointed out the exact same problem that I had. Unbelievable that anyone could screw up such a simple design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality strap mateiral is beginning to rip/tear after first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to tie down surfboards and a few other items to a roof rack for a camping trip. I gave two stars due to the fact the straps didn't fail COMPLETELY but, they've already started to rip and tear in multiple places due to the low quality material used for the straps. I would suggest spending a bit more on straps that will hold up over time and not begin to rip on the first use
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Although it does the job.... pushing the strap through the latch can be a little tricky. You have to push the latch release very far down in order to slide the strap through and the release latch is kinda short/small which make it a little tuff to push down far enough to slide strap through. However, once it's in, it's good to go. This is the only reason i didn't give it the fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Very strong straps and great length.
customer_reviews.text: The straps I got were better quality than listed. They are made of a weave more like seat belts. I have not had them under heavy load to know if they can slip worse, but the material is extremely strong. I am using them to tie down 10'4"x31" kayaks on j bars. 12' is a good length to easily get them over and have enough of a tail to tie off. The original 8' straps that came with my j bars were too short. The carry bag is nice to have too and has space for even more straps. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Cartman Straps
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I needed for the Christmas ornament boxes I have that have handles. I could not pick up the boxes by the handles without them coming apart. These straps keep the boxes together and I can uses the handles to carry them. This is my second order. Ordered 1 box last Christmas and when I bought more ornament boxes I ordered another set of these straps. I cut off the excess length and my husband melts the end so as not to ravel. The excess my husband takes to his barn. I have 4 left over but if I run out I will order more from Cartman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kayaks
customer_reviews.text: A great value! I only need to use four to tie down two kayaks on the roof racks. Holds them down tight going 70+ mph.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That, Got The T-Shirt

customer_reviews.title: Good value for light to medium tie down uses
customer_reviews.text: Used this to secure small powered hand drill to a heavy wood shelf for use as an ad hoc bench grinder. Straps are sturdier than I expected and the hardware is compact and low profile. Will use these as supplemental to the larger ratchet strap for car rack tie downs. As I use these more and more, may consider additional purchases.
customer_reviews.author: D Teru

customer_reviews.title: Excellent straps. Used them to tie down a Kayak ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent straps. Used them to tie down a Kayak to the roof rack on the truck. They are very well made. The clasps are good quality and do a great job of holding the nylon strap in place. The stitching is of great quality. I was very confident in their ability to keep the kayak strapped to my truck while driving on the highway. If I had a complaint, I'd say I wish they were a little longer but I knew what I was getting into when I bought these and I havent really seen any other one's on amazon that are longer. I'd buy and use with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Rishi

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: The cam locks are nice and heavy duty, weighty and with good springs... the first strap I used started to tear after its very first use .. after its second use its about ready for the garbage. Guess I will buy a roll of strap and use the clips to make my own but .. look elsewhere for good straps. In this case .. inexpensive just means cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Mechanism doesn't release the strap
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy straps that I bought to secure a SUP to my car roof. Unfortunately, there seems to be a problem with the very simple release mechanism in that the teeth are digging so hard into the strap that when I press the release, the strap is caught in the teeth. I have now had to cut two of the six traps off with scissors. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: TD03063

customer_reviews.title: well there bright green
customer_reviews.text: the big flaw is the teeth that hold the strap are so long and sharp that once you cinch it, it's very hard to release. a real fight as that is shreds the nylon and leaves it damaged --- you have been warned
customer_reviews.author: vegas massimo

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I tried using these straps to hold my kayak down on my cart, but the release was so narrow that I could not loosen the straps once the kayak was secure. Fortunately I was able to wiggle the kayak off the cart, otherwise I would have needed to cut the straps. I replaced them with another brand that works much better
customer_reviews.author: lkemper

customer_reviews.title: Low quality metal cam cleats and webbing -
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT trust these for intensive load tie down uses. While they are better than polyester rope, they are nowhere near expedition lashing quality. The plastic webbing is slippery in the cam, and I fully expect them to dissolve in UV conditions. I consider them disposable. Since I got 8...the pack will last a bit. Cheap asian product, not for highway use.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep around for household chores and good value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these little straps are handy to have around --- currently using two to hold a container to a wooden dolly when it is being moved from place to place - the excess length of one strap works as a pull handle for the load. The buckle mechanism is easy to use, holds tight and has not slipped yet. Will be getting a van soon and will probably use the rest of the straps to secure loose items like boxes in the back of the van. Not using outside so can't say as to how these would take weathering but happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was so impressed I'm buying another set now!
customer_reviews.text: These are quality straps that can be used in a number of diverse applications, and whether securing something to your car, or someone in your bedroom you won't be disappointed! The straps are thick enough to do the job without feeling too stiff, and the buckle is extremely well made where it grips tight without slipping. The only suggestion I may have is if you are planning on using it to restrain someone is to place something over the metal buckle as it can feel cold against the skin! I liked them so much I am about to place my second order and believe you will as well...
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: cheap...not inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: the straps are the cheapest "webbing" i have ever encountered. after 1st, 2nd and 3rd use i had to cut the strap shorter, as the webbing was so snagged and frayed. ultimately, i will have to replace it with proper climbing webbing before long...but at this price, i am done complaining. i'm using these for my bikes, so it's not a huge deal, but i would not trust them with any "heavy" cargo.
customer_reviews.author: HanjiSolo

customer_reviews.title: Great grip. Maybe even too great.
customer_reviews.text: They definitely hold themselves in place. Zero slippage on my kayaks on a 300 mile roundtrip journey. However, the clasps bite very deep, and with tension, can get nearly impossible to loosen. I had to cut two of the four I was using at the time, and the other two were mangled enough from the teeth that I imagine they’ve got 1 or 2 trips left in them before they’re unsafe. Still, they hold well and they’re pretty inexpensive. 4 stars for sturdiness and girl, with a missing star for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Sean J. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: These tie back straps are fantastic for many uses
customer_reviews.text: These tie back straps are fantastic for many uses. I planted several trees and used them as tie back straps.I also have a 17 foot manual patio awning that I used these for tie down straps, when winds are high. Going to order another set for future use. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Rickaren

customer_reviews.title: Simple but solid design
customer_reviews.text: After the earthquake last year, I had several pieces of hardware that were tossed around the room. Two were damaged and caused damage to the walls and electrical Wall outlets. I will be using these straps to secure the machines to bases I’m building. This should secure them safely and still allow access to move them as needed.
customer_reviews.author: oatie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used many straps like these over the years. These use a very soft nylon that did not hold up that well to wear, though they seemed to have the strength advertised when new. I found that because the nylon is soft, the buckle teeth bit deeply into the straps, making it difficult to release after using a good bit of tension. These work, but I am not expecting them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Shreeves

customer_reviews.title: Trash for Kayaks!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is these are trash the teeth dig into the thread and when it's tighten down it's almost impossible to get them off. The thread gets grabbed by the teeth on the clamp. Would not recommend if a Kayak on the roof of a car.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: A while back I bought a set of the black straps and really liked them so I decided to order some more. The cams on the new ones kept getting stuck in the straps I dunno if its because the spikes are too sharp, or if it’s because they’re at an angle it makes them not usable for my purposes. I returned one set, but the replacements had the same problem. I’m going to attempt to do what one of the other reviewers did and use a Dremel to grind them down a bit. Hopefully that will fix them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap thin straps to be expected for the price. They will definatly hold gear down and plenty strong enough for moveing and small jobs. The clamps have really sharp teeth and they want to snag into the cordage and get hung up. But easily fixed by fileing them down just a bit to dull them up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Hard to loosen if they’re truly tight
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut one of these after using it to secure my kayak to my car because I simply couldn’t get the strap to come loose. The teeth hold well but are very difficult to use when you want to loosen a tight strap. I also hit a pothole and the 2 straps holding my kayak instantly loosened a ton on the bounce. Guesssing that would happen with most straps though.
customer_reviews.author: nicole w

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you only want to use them once
customer_reviews.text: The buckles won’t release if they are under load. So, if you cinch down the straps tight, the teeth on the cam dig into the nylon and keep the buckle from releasing when you press on the lever. I managed to work it free, but it damaged the strap and will be a pain every time I use them. You’re better off getting one or two good cam straps from NRS instead of six crappy ones.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Davies

customer_reviews.title: It's got teeth...
customer_reviews.text: The "teeth" on the cam buckle are very sharp/pointy, so much so that it bites and snags on the softer, nylon webbing. You can pull the straps through to tighten them down, but you cannot pull them back out without them constantly getting stuck on the teeth. It's so bad, it actually starts to fray the webbing of the strap. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: RyanB

customer_reviews.title: Good straps
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price. I have used them to hold down both our kayaks on our rack and also a large canoe... no problems at all. The straps aren't the thickest so they are a bit difficult to work through the buckle. I could probably cut them at an angle and then melt the frayed ends a bit... but so far not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: releasing the strap
customer_reviews.text: I found that the strands of the nylon material that the strap is made of get caught in the teeth of the cam lock. When the jaw is opened to slide the strap out it isn't that easy. the strap must be pulled such that the strands disengage from the teeth and then the strap comes out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The design of buckle have problem
customer_reviews.text: This it to strip down items on my car roof and this is a great value for the price. But the problem comes in the buckle, these tooth inside the buckle is way too sharp to bite down too much on the strap, 4 out of 6 strips that I can't release the strip. Ended up, I have to cut the loose.
customer_reviews.author: PK9394Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Used, damage, and different parts than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was sold garbage... Not only are the straps I received, not the same as in the picture advertisement. There's only one strap in the box, is used and full of rust. What FN company would sell something like that? Now I have to use my time and gas, to return this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: CARTMAN 1" x 12' Lashing Straps up to 600lbs, 4-10pk Quantity for Option in Carry Bag (6pk)
feature_bullets: Cartman 12-foot long-by-1-inch wide lashing strap in 6-pack. For general use cargo tie down where a hook is not needed. Securely tightens loads to 200-pounds of actual use and 600-pounds of break strength. Features silver protectant finish that offers a rich appearance and 3x more corrosion resistance. Includes solid steel cast metal clamp

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,253 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
